required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018

clinical_study.brief_title: Ectopic Adipose Tissue, Exercise Training and IL-6
clinical_study.official_title: Ectopic Adipose Tissue, Exercise Training and IL-6 - A Human Intervention Study Investigating the Role of Exercise Training on Ectopic Adipose Tissue and Gastric Emptying - Mechanisms of Action.

brief_summary.textblock:
Aim: Exercise training improves the risk of cardiometabolic diseases; yet the underlying mechanisms are unclear. Exercise induces release of IL-6 from skeletal muscle. Acute elevations in IL-6 improve lipid and glucose metabolism, the latter partly through a delayed gastric emptying. Physical inactivity causes accumulation of visceral fat (VAT). Visceral and epicardial adipose tissue (EAT) is more inflamed than subcutaneous adipose tissue. Thus, the investigators hypothesize that exercise-induced IL-6 mediates the exercise-induced reduction in EAT and VAT. Secondly, the investigators hypothesize that exercise-induced adaptations in glucose metabolism and gastric motility are dependent on IL-6. Finally the investigators hypothesise that both endurance and resistance exercise training reduce VAT and EAT.
Primary aim: To investigate the effects of exercise training on VAT and to determine to what extend IL-6 mediates this effect.
Secondary aims: 1) To determine whether 12 weeks of endurance and strength training can reduce the amount of EAT. 2) To study whether the effects of exercise on glucose metabolism and gastric emptying are dependent on IL-6.
Methods: Inclusion: 70 inactive men and women, >18 years, waist to height ratio > 0.5 and/or waist circumference ≥ 88 cm (women); waist circumference ≥ 102 cm (men) Design: A 12-week, double-blinded randomised, placebo-controlled exercise intervention study.
Intervention: Subjects will be randomised to one of five groups: i) Tocilizumab (IL-6 receptor antibody) and endurance training, ii) Placebo to Tocilizumab and endurance training, iii) Tocilizumab, no exercise iv) Placebo to Tocilizumab and no training, and v) Placebo to Tocilizumab, and resistance training. Tocilizumab/placebo dose will be administered (according to standard recommendations) before the first training session, and maintained during the 12-week training program. Training will be supervised to ensure intensity and compliance. Subjects will be instructed not to change eating habits and informed that this study does not aim for a weight loss.
Statistical considerations: Study investigators are blinded to treatment allocation. Dropouts will be replaced. A sample size of 70 subjects is needed to detect a 10% change in visceral adipose, with a power of 80% and a significance level of 0.05.

primary_outcome.description: Visceral fat mass will be measured by MRI before and after the intervention. Difference in change in visceral fat mass from baseline to 12 weeks follow up will be compared between group: Endurancetraining + tocilizumab and group: Endurancetraining + placebo.

secondary_outcome.description: Difference in change in visceral fat mass from baseline to 12 weeks follow up will be compared between group: Endurancetraining + placebo and group: no training + placebo.
2. Difference in change in visceral fat mass from baseline to 12 weeks follow up will be compared between group: Endurancetraining + placebo and group: resistance training + placebo.
3. Difference in change in visceral fat mass from baseline to 12 weeks follow up will be compared between group: Endurancetraining + tocilizumab and group: no training + tocilizumab.
4. Difference in change in visceral fat mass from baseline to 12 weeks follow up will be compared between group: resistance training + placebo and group: no training + placebo.
5. Difference in change in visceral fat mass from baseline to 12 weeks follow up will be compared between group: no training + placebo and group: no training + tocilizumab.
Cardiac fat volume will be measured by a cardiac MRI scan before and after the interventions. All groups will be compared.

Gastric emptying will be measured by paracetamol blood levels (mmol/l) before and after the interventions. The paracetamol levels will be compared between groups as follows. Group: Endurancetraining + tocilizumab and group: Endurancetraining + placebo. Group: Endurancetraining + placebo and group: no training + placebo. Group: Endurancetraining + tocilizumab and group: no training + tocilizumab. Group: No training + placebo and group: no training + tocilizumab.

other_outcome.measure: Peri- and paracardial adipose tissue volume (measured by MRI)
Body composition analysis (measured by Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry)
Waist circumference (measured in cm)
BMI (kg/m^2, weight in kilograms, height in meters)
Resting blood pressure as a measure of cardiovascular function
Maximal aerobic capacity (cardiovascular fitness) (VO2 peak)
Muscle strength measured by one repetition maximum (1RM)
Oral glucose tolerance test
Glycemic control during mixed meal tolerance test
Free-living glycemic control using continuous glucose monitoring
Pro- and anti-inflammatory cytokines(Interleukin-6, Interleukin-1ra, Interleukin-1, Interleukin-18, Interleukin-15, Interleukin-10)
soluble Interleukin-6 receptor (sIL-6R)
soluble gp130
Adipose characteristic by blood markers
Cortisol
Catecholamines (Epinephrine and norepinephrine)
leukocytes
Glucagon
Blood lipid
Cardiovascular function assessed by blood markers
Inflammation status assessed by blood markers
Adipose biopsy to assess the adipokine expression signature
Photo of subjects
other_outcome.description: To asses if the visual appearance of the stomach is reflecting the amount of visceral fat mass and to see if there is a difference in the visual appearance before and after the intervention

other_outcome.measure: Faecal and urine samples to asses changes in the microbiome
Change in sleepiness
Exercise factors during an acute exercise bout
other_outcome.time_frame: Timepoints: 0, 22, 45, 01:45, 02:45, before and after the intervention (0,12 weeks)

other_outcome.measure: Glucose metabolism during an acute exercise bout
other_outcome.time_frame: Timepoints: 0, 22, 45, 01:45, 02:45, before and after the intervention (0,12 weeks)
other_outcome.description: At each timepoint exercise factors: cortisol, il-6, epinephrine and norepinephrine will be measured. Furthermore pro anti-inflammatory cytokines, glucose, insulin, C-peptide, C-reactive protein will be reported.

other_outcome.measure: Whole blood stimulation with Lipopolysaccharide and phytohaemagglutinin
other_outcome.time_frame: During the acute exercise bout at Timepoints: 0, 22, 45, 01:45, 02:45, before and after the intervention (0,12 weeks)
other_outcome.description: in vitro stimulation of whole blood.

other_outcome.measure: Fibroblast growth factor 21
other_outcome.time_frame: During the acute exercise bout at Timepoints: 0, 22, 45, 01:45, 02:45, before and after the intervention (0,12 weeks)

other_outcome.measure: oxidative burst in neutrophils
other_outcome.time_frame: During the acute exercise bout at Timepoints: 0, 22, 45, 01:45, 02:45, before and after the intervention (0,12 weeks)

other_outcome.measure: gastrointestinal health
other_outcome.description: A questionnaire regarding gastrointestinal symptoms. A Visual Analog Score will be used.

other_outcome.measure: Physical activity
other_outcome.description: Self-report physical activity using The Minnesota Leisure Time Physical Activity Questionnaire

other_outcome.measure: Diet registration
Satiety
other_outcome.description: self-report using a satiety questionnaire during mixed meal tolerance test

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac function measured by heart rate recovery
Muscle biopsy to assess expression of exercise induced cytokines
Coronary sinus flow reserve as a measure of global perfusion using MRI
Insulin during mixed meal tolerance test
C-peptide during mixed meal tolerance test
Glucagon during mixed meal tolerance test
GLP-1 during mixed meal tolerance test
Insulin sensitivity index (Matsuda) based on mixed meal tolerance test
Insulin secretion index based on mixed meal tolerance test
IL-6 released in respons to an exercise bout
other_outcome.time_frame: one of the first 3 and one of the last 3 exercise bouts
other_outcome.description: IL-6 in plasma measured before and after an exercise bout

arm_group.description: Endurance exercise training + monthly infusion of Tocilizumab
Endurance exercise training + monthly infusion of placebo
No exercise + monthly infusion of Tocilizumab
No exercise training + monthly infusion of placebo
Resistance exercise training + monthly infusion of placebo

intervention.description: Three months of supervised training. Interval training, 3 sessions weekly of 45 min. During intervals the intensity will be minimum 70 % of VO2 max
Three months of supervised resistance training. Subjects will perform 3 weekly sessions of 45 min. The intensity will be kept at minimum 60% of 1RM.
Tocilizumab infusion will be administered monthly (8 mg/kg body weight i.v., maximun 800 mg). Each subject will receive 3 infusions during the study period.
Saline infusion will be administered monthly (same volume as Tocilizumab). Each subject will receive 3 infusions during the study period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women
- Sedentary
- Waist to height ratio ≥ ½ and/or waist circumference ≥ 88 cm (women); waist circumference ≥ 102 cm (men)
- Age ≥ 18 y
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Diagnosed with diabetes (HbA1c ≥ 48 mmol/mol or fasting glucose ≥ 7.0 mmol/l)
- Diagnosed with ischemic heart disease
- Atrial fibrillation
- Treatment with biologic rheumatic drugs, systemic prednisolone or other immunosuppressive treatments
- Health conditions that prevents individuals from participating in the exercise training intervention e.g. severe obesity
- Patients who cannot undergo MRI scans (e.g. kidney disease, metallic implants or claustrophobia)

facility.name: Rigshospitalet, Centre of Inflammation and Metabolism (CIM) Centre for Physical Activity Research (CFAS)
